articles.title: About
articles.contents:
Interests ~
Some people have an idea about how they want to spend their life from
a very young age — a calling so-to-speak, beckoning them in a certain
direction. I’ve never been that way: almost everything interests me.
I’ve always wanted to embrace all of my different passions and try to
find some way to make them all work together, which is exactly what I’ve
been able to explore and formulate throughout my undergraduate
education. Next year, I hope to attend a Masters program that will help
me translate my synthesis of interests to a more professional setting
and enhance my confidence in solving complex technical problems.
I gravitated toward the interdisciplinary field of Environmental
Studies in my undergraduate studies, despite arriving undeclared.
However, by the end of my second year, I, expectedly, felt there was
still more to explore, and decided to undertake two more majors in
Linguistics and History of Art and Architecture. Through the three very
different, yet interconnected, lenses, I have been fostering a greater
passion for computational data methods and opening my mind to a depth of
issues in urbanism and sustainability. Without these different lenses, I
would feel much less prepared to help tackle the complex issues that
exist in our society today. In graduate school and beyond, I would like
to apply these lenses to analyzing urban-centered socio-environmental
topics, such as food insecurity, urban forestry, public health, noise
pollution, and city planning, improving the sustainability and equity of
cities.
Experience / major projects ~
Click here for a pdf
version of my CV/resume including the below information plus
more!
FAMST
54: Hollywood Industry, Film and Media Studies Department, UCSB, Goleta,
CA
Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
September 2021-Present
Assisting Professor Cheri Steinkellner with grading assignments,
answering student questions, and tasks during class lectures
Your Children’s Trees,
UCSB, Goleta, CA
Board Member (Treasurer)
September 2021-Present
Managing spreadsheets of intern stipend allocations, applying for
grants, performing requisitions for funding, and completing various
administrative tasks to maintain registered student organization status,
as well as discussing and voting on major board decisions with other
board members
Marine
Science Institute (MSI) Analytical Lab, UCSB, Goleta, CA
Student Lab Assistant
April 2021-Present
Prepping researchers’ samples for CHN (carbon-hydrogen-nitrogen) and
mass spectrometry analysis (including checking in sample arrivals,
acidifying samples, weighing samples) and assisting with lab upkeep
National
Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis (NCEAS) Arctic Data Center
(ADC), UCSB, Santa Barbara, CA
Data Management Intern
June 2020-Present
Utilizing a keen attention to detail to organize, manage, and
archive data from environmental research projects using RStudio
Communicating professionally with researchers via email to create an
accurate representation of said data
Collaborating with teammates to troubleshoot each others’ code and
review each others’ datasets
Analyzing the training guides for potential edits in protocol
Occasionally helping to fix bugs within the ADC’s functions in
R
Regents Scholars
Association, UCSB, Goleta, CA
Board Member
May 2020-Present
Planning events for other Regents Scholars, incorporating diverse
fields of research as well as transitioning events effectively to a
well-attended online format during COVID-19
Fostering a welcoming, supportive environment in the club and acting
as a resource for advice and information for members
Your Children’s Trees,
UCSB, Goleta, CA
Tree Care Intern
April 2021-September 2021
Performing maintenance on trees at urban locations in the SB and
Goleta area in a large team
MacDonald Lab, UCSB, Goleta,
CA
Undergraduate Research Assistant
March 2021-August 2021
Uncovering intersections between the effects of COVID-19 and
environmental factors through data analysis and synthesis with Google
Earth Engine and R
A
Visual Narrative of Food Insecurity in Santa Barbara County: an
interactive geographic data visualization created during ENV S 195:
Environmental Leadership Incubator, UCSB, Goleta, CA
Co-Creator
September 2020-June 2021
Collaborating to research and construct a map demonstrating
correlations between poverty levels and other factors to aid the Santa
Barbara Food Bank in determining viable new food distribution locations,
and learning new software (Tableau) and troubleshooting along the way,
concluding in apresentation on our findings
A
Drop in the Sand: a 10-minute long animated short film created during
FAMST 106: Crew Production, UCSB, Goleta, CA
Producer and Colorist
September 2020-March 2021
Co-leading a team of 30+ individuals to help manage production flow,
our LLC, budgeting, fundraising (raising over $6000) and perk
fulfillment, and social media presence for the film, as well as
assisting with coloring numerous frames for the film in Toon Boom
Harmony
LING 20 and LING 117, UCSB,
Goleta, CA
Undergraduate Assistant
September 2020-December 2020
Assisting Professor Kennedy with restructuring his quizzes and other
assignments in LING 20 and LING 117 for clarity as he transitioned his
courses to better fit the atmosphere of online learning
D’Antonio Lab, UCSB, Goleta,
CA
Undergraduate Research Assistant
September 2019-June 2020
Working in the field and lab on a project investigating chaparral
restoration into a degraded chaparral stand, assisting in the set-up of
the experimental plots, transplanting seedlings, monitoring seedlings
for survival and growth, and collecting environmental metrics of
landscape-scale and localized-scale plot characteristics, and entering
this data into Google Sheets
Learning to analyze data using R
Santa
Barbara Coastal - Long Term Ecological Research (SBC-LTER) Kelp Farm,
UCSB, Goleta, CA
Undergraduate Research Assistant
October 2019-April 2020
Assisting the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy (ARPA-E)
Kelp Farm research project in its investigations on phenotypic,
breeding, and farming giant kelp as part of a giant kelp genome
association study by processing kelp samples through:
annotating kelp images to assist in training deep learning
analysis software
grinding and drying kelp; entering data
performing miscellaneous lab and field tasks pertaining to kelp
farm such as chemical analysis preparation

Cheadle
Center Biodiversity and Ecological Restoration (CCBER), UCSB, Goleta,
CA
NCOS Restoration Student Worker
April 2019-September 2019
Weeding non-native plants from the North Campus Open Space
restoration site and planting native plants, learning to identify
various natives and non-natives by name and appearance, and learning
about restoration techniques

            Erika Egg is a fourth year undergraduate triple majoring
            in Environmental Studies, Linguistics (Emphasis in Speech
            and Language Technologies), and History of Art and
            Architecture (Emphasis in Architecture and Environment) at
            UCSB. She hopes to acquire an educational background that
            can help her better understand the increasingly
            interdisciplinary nature of the world as it applies to urban
            dynamics and sustainability. She currently aids with data
            management as an intern with the NCEAS Arctic Data Center as
            well as conducts sample prep for the MSI Analytical Lab.
            This coming Spring she will also be reprising her role as a
            TA for FAMST 54 at UCSB.
